title: N.Korea Rejects Talks Over Mt. Kumgang Resort
text:
North Korea on Tuesday rejected South Korea's proposal of talks to discuss the situation surrounding halted tours to the North's Mt. Kumgang resort and a sprawling South Korean-funded hotel complex there.

The South had proposed working-level talks a day earlier to "discuss a new development direction" for the scenic resort and stop the North demolishing the facilities. But North Korea sent a notification to South Korea that it will go ahead with the demolition "by exchanging documents without the need to hold working-level talks."

Last Wednesday, state media revealed that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un ordered the destruction of "all the unsightly facilities" built with South Korean money in the early millennium, when a brief thaw got package tours to the mountain underway.

The government appeared unfazed and still busy trying to resuscitate the doomed cross-border venture, which was halted when a North Korean soldier shot dead a South Korean tourist in Mt. Kumgang in 2010.
description: N.Korea Rejects Talks Over Mt. Kumgang Resort
